meanings.definition: Loyalty to or pride in a particular area or region.
meanings.sent1: Her strong localism made her always support the hometown team.
meanings.sent2: The community's localism was evident in their celebration of unique local traditions.
meanings.sent3: His localism was so extreme that he only ate food grown in his neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The localism of the town was like a warm embrace, welcoming all who shared its values.
meanings.sent5: The localism of the village was so infectious, even newcomers quickly felt like longtime residents.

meanings.definition: The practice of favoring local goods, services, or customs over those from outside the area.
meanings.sent1: The localism of the market encouraged people to buy products made by local artisans.
meanings.sent2: Localism in business helped small shops thrive against big chain stores.
meanings.sent3: The localism of the town was so extreme that they even had a local currency.
meanings.sent4: Her commitment to localism was like a shield, protecting the community from outside influences.
meanings.sent5: The localism of the region was a beacon of sustainability, promoting local resources over imports.
